alert.note: Alert for Martin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:31PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Martin, east central Floyd and northern Pike Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1031 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oppy to Rural to near Gulnare. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Whitepost, Rural and Oppy around 1035 PM EDT. Canada and Turkey Creek around 1050 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Forest Hills, Belfry, Hardy, Huddy and Mcandrews. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 8 and 24. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 2 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern and northeastern Kentucky.
